Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
public class Game extends Object
Represents a game between two players, tracking the progress of turns played, and determining the winner based on a set number of wins.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int winsToPlayUntil, Player player1, Player player2)
      Constructs a Game with specified winning criteria and players.
      Parameters:
      winsToPlayUntil - the number of wins required for a player to win the game.
      player1 - the first player in the game.
      player2 - the second player in the game.

  • Method Details

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Checks if the game has finished, which occurs when either player reaches the required wins.
      Returns:
      true if the game is finished, false otherwise.

    • updateWinScores

      private void updateWinScores(Outcome outcome)
      Updates the win count for the player who won the turn.
      Parameters:
      outcome - the outcome of the turn, determining which player won.

    • playTurn

      public Turn playTurn()
      Executes a turn in the game where each player chooses their move, updates scores, and records the turn.
      Returns:
      the completed turn with the choices and outcome.
